title: I want to play LoL. But it's becoming too much.
body:
Before I start, I will point out, I am a 27 year old guy. 
I study para-medicine & work as an International Bodyguard/Private Security Officer when I'm not teaching Krav Maga back home.

My job is prevention. I Identify behaviour traits and patterns to ascertain risk level and minimize chances of said risk becoming an actuality.
*That said, I already see it's not a great idea to post a thread such as this on these boards. *
But hey, I don't have to risk my life on this one, I only lose a moments time.

Regardless, I do recognize the gap in *"demographics"* I force myself into by playing LoL. Considering LoL is largely a younger player-base. 

Don't get me wrong.
The game itself can be fun and challenging. **Which is why we play games don't we?**
Characters, Mechanics, Spells and Game Modes to name a few selling points.


The player-base however.
It is like watching the slow degradation of humanity.

While I admit it is prevalent in real life, and that **I am far from a perfect example of what humanity has to offer**, the ever growing *"shield of internet"* people wear makes 'communities' such as LoL hard to bear. And, quite often, contributes to humanities degradation at a much faster rate.

A few points I noticed:

**1. Ego.**
This game reeks of it. From the top down.

*-Announcers in the world streams.* From the way they speak. It is so "know it all" it can be hard to watch the play-by-play breakdowns and Panel discussions.
*-"Pro players"*. Skills and knowledge of the game? You betchya. Nobody is taking that away from them.
Unsportsman-like attitudes? Oh we know it to be true. (Though not all are guilty). And it does set an example.
*-Casual gamers.* Just play a few games and see.


For a lot of this identification of ego being present, you can literally watch the interactions in facial expression, team communications, narrations of live streams and webcams of LoL players. Doing this, you can see how especially in the *"pro circuit"* the ego is immense .
Or just jump on the forum.

**Ego is not a good thing.** 
And what is scary is the fact that while, *that kid probably wont go and shoot up his school because he played Postal 2*, the physical** and** mental behavioural patterns that are created by people who **routinely** exhibit these types of attitudes (such as being ego-centric jerks), ACTUALLY have the patterns manifest in real life encounters.

In fact, I have had the "miss fortune" :P of working and training alongside people who exhibited the aforementioned traits.
They never make it far.

Ego is a f***ing monster. All it does is hinder true growth and understanding. 


I want to point out something that perhaps is a bit of a *'nitpicking'* but, even that LoL world championships 2014 song "Warriors"

Look at the character interactions. 
The glares at one another.
The Looks of the characters (a gross misperception to the reality of how the players actually look. Though I'm not here to debate what a gamer should look like.)
Even the lyrics. Apart from the opening verse being ironically hypocritical, the lyrics alongside the imagery depict a fair amount of Ego in the characters whom are meant to be (I imagine) a reflection of the LoL community.

Overall, the Ego is strong in this community. 



**2. Sheep. Far out LoL players can act like sheep. **
It's as though ANYTHING you do in a game and you are flamed. UNLESS Faker did it. Or someone else from the *"pro"* league.
And god forbid you want to use something/someone you are good at over what is considered 'acceptable'.

Then something you were flamed for a week ago can now be the norm because "some guy did it in his stream."


Also, "Words" used in games (and now Real Life).
*Now this will also tie into my next point. (I will give examples there)*

It takes a week for someone to come up with a new turn of phrase and BAM...everyone is doing it.
While it is funny at first, and in small moderation, these behavioural traits infect people subconsciously and it does manifest into real life habit.
I will prove it to you in the next section.


**3. Language skills.**
(Just a **few** examples)
*Rekt. wot? Dat smite doe. Fast blitz is fast.*
And my personal hatred.
The over-use of the verbal filler "Like"

Most people are utterly oblivious as to just how much they use such words known as "verbal fillers"
It is literally used because people want to talk faster than they are actually thinking. Then, it becomes a habit. 

Now the proof. 
Go and listen to a friend talk. Or a sibling. Hell, watch the recent LoL panel-type discussions or streams. You will hear it more when you are aware of it. And when you become aware of it. It becomes painful to listen to. 
You can literally remove most (if not all) the uses of the word "like" in many people's sentence structure and have it **not only** make perfect sense, **but** it will actually sound less imbecilic.

If I hear someone in my industry talk like this, it's usually understood that they aren't a desired team member as it shows the lack of thought.
Yes even a lack of thought before speech can lead to a lack of thought before action. *(Plus it's downright unprofessional.)*
The body/mind works this way. Patterns and habits.



Not many people actually know that the *"like"* habit began in the 80's with the pitiful "Valley Girl" trend.

And now, it is so prevalent that I have seen people WRITE it in sentences.
*Talk about utterly superfluous.*

Using this word instead of the multitude of verbs that the English language offers isn't evolution – it’s regression. It’s nothing more than a grammatical cancer.

*(Though it is less prevalent throughout European/Asian countries as opposed to Native English ones..though I fear it could spread)*




**If you stuck with me thus far, then kudos!**

I know it was a long one, however I had a moment and thought I'd have a bit of a gripe.


Overall, I am feeling that this community is painfully regressed beyond what I can stand.
The *(possible)* responses I get to this thread could send me packing, or potentially give me a shred of light here.

I would note that I would like to stick around - because lets face it, player-base aside, LoL is a pretty fun game as far as MOBAs are concerned.
And Riot offers quite a lot to its customers.


Thanks again if you stuck with me.

Cheers ~
